case_vignette: A 30-year-old woman presents to her primary care provider complaining of intermittent fever and loss of appetite for the past 2 weeks. She is also concerned about painful genital lesions. Past medical history is noncontributory. She takes oral contraceptives and a multivitamin daily. She has had two male sexual partners in her lifetime and uses condoms inconsistently. She admits to being sexually active with 2 partners in the last 3 months and only using condoms on occasion. Today, her vitals are normal. On pelvic exam, there are red-rimmed, fluid-filled blisters over the labia minora (as seen in the photograph below) with swollen and tender inguinal lymph nodes.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis of this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing on-and-off fever and a lack of appetite for the past couple of weeks, and I'm really concerned about these painful sores in my private area.
Have you noticed any blisters or ulcers in the genital area?
Yes, I have these painful, red, fluid-filled blisters around my private parts.
Do you have any pain or burning during urination?
No, I haven't mentioned any pain or burning when I pee.
Have you had these symptoms or blisters before?
No, this is the first time I've had these symptoms and blisters.
Have you engaged in unprotected sexual activity recently?
Yes, I've been sexually active with two partners in the last three months and didn't always use condoms.
Do you have any known allergies or are you currently taking any medications?
I don't have any known allergies, and I'm currently taking oral contraceptives and a multivitamin daily.
Final Diagnosis: Genital herpes.

I've been having intermittent fever and loss of appetite for the past 2 weeks, and I'm also concerned about painful sores in my genital area.

I am a 30-year-old woman.
Do you have any history of similar symptoms in the past?
No, I don't have any history of similar symptoms.
Have you been sexually active? If so, have you had any new sexual partners recently or engaged in unprotected sex?
Yes, I've been sexually active with 2 partners in the last 3 months and I've only used condoms sometimes.

I have swollen and tender lymph nodes in my groin area.

Yes, I have red-rimmed, fluid-filled blisters over the labia minora that are painful.
Have you ever been tested for sexually transmitted infections (STIs) before, and do you have any known allergies or medical conditions?
My past medical history is noncontributory, which means I don't have any known allergies or medical conditions, and it doesn't say whether I've been tested for STIs before.
Final Diagnosis: Genital herpes.
